sub_title: Grant Advisor THUAS/EC Proposal evaluator and reviewer
summary:
I have 23 years experience which bridge knowledge and practice between research universities, international development and individual consultancies.

I am an analytical and motivated professional with extensive experience in developing fundraising and business development strategies, setting up consortia for collaborative research projects and leading proposal development process between consortium partners. Strategies for international profiling of institutions (public and non-for profit) are my forte.

My passion lies in reading strategies, research and project portfolios of different partners from different sectors, analyzing and mapping them with grant-givers. Thinking on research uptake as a way to develop the sustainability of research results is yet another element of my daily work which I do enjoy thinking along with lecturers and researchers while they are developing their proposals.

Further, I am dedicated to capacity-building of different target groups on creation of networks and consortium for collaborative research projects, on project proposal writing and project cycle management.

I derive a lot of satisfaction from reading and giving feedback on research proposals as well as on evaluating collaborative research projects either for European Commission Programs or other Research Funding Institutes in Europe.

Demonstrated success in managing projects and coordinating research, conducting research, collecting and analyzing data, solving problems, and communicating those results clearly to different audiences. 

During my research years (research master, PhD and Post-doc) my research interests were focused in: governing of service delivery in low (Sub-Saharan Africa - DRC) and middle income countries (Western Balkans - Albania); welfare and reconciliation policies in Europe, family planning and intergenerational division of child-care in extended families in the former communist EE Block and DRC, and gender and international development.

company.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description: This project focuses on the governing of family planning in local fragile settings in South-Kivu, Eastern DRC. Understanding and analyzing the policy implementation from the perspective of different governmental and non-governmental stakeholders and providers, and analyzing the perception of different generations of local Congolese on natural and new family planning methods, and their practice with these methods are the main intentions of this policy evaluation.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.location: Utrecht University, Gender Graduate Program, Research Institute for M&C
profile_positions.description:
Reseach topic: "Lone mothers and welfare policies in Albania. Experiences, Conditions, Expectations. 1944-2013".

Conducting research on lone mothers and welfare policies in Albania for a time-span of 70 years. The research process involved the conduction of a field-work for 8.5 months during 2011-2013. 268 interviews are conducted with lone mothers in 10 disctricts in the North, South and Central Albania. Interviews with representatives of the Socio-Economic Aid Departments in the municipalities of 10 discricts, the Social State Service, and representatives of local women NPOs (former NGOs) and local religious institutions (catholic, orthodox, evangelican and muslim organizations) were part of the data gathering methodology.
profile_positions.title: PHD Researcher

company.name: CRAN - Coordinatie Raad Albanezen in Nederland

volunteer_experiences.description:
During a period of two years from May 2011-September 2012, I supported the Leading Board of CRAN, to organize for the first time in the Netherlands "The Cultural Day of Albanians".

It was a united effort of the Leading Board, which brought together about 370 Albanians of Kosovo and 17 Albanians of Albania. In this multi-functional day, the invitants played football with representatives from other communities, tasted the Albanian culinaries, visited a book fair, visited the exhibitions of Albanian painters Eduard Bace and Arjeta Mala. Moreover the Albanian painter with an International fame Shefqet Avdush Emini offered painting workshops for children and adults during this day and Mr. Vranovcki showed a historical documentary for Albania. A group of Albanian dancers from "Vatra" association in Belgium, were invited to dance in this event.

During this period I organized the 'Albanian Women of Kosovo' in meeting groups to discuss about women`s rights in Albania and in Kosovo and to celebrate together the International Women`s Day.

From September-6 November 2014 I supported "Skampa" Foundation in organizing a beneficiary concert with the Bulgarian-Dutch pianist Marietta Petkova. The aim of this concert was to raise funds for the project "All children in school" for Roma, Egyptian and children from families in need in Elbasani-Albania.

With Alex Le Mat and Richard van den Brik
